snippet: The Labor Department said on Tuesday that its so-called core Consumer Price Index, which excludes food and energy, gained 0.2 percent last month, as it did in September and October.
abstract: Labor Dept says its core Consumer Price Index rose 0.2 percent in November, matching September and October increases.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department said on Tuesday that its so-called core Consumer Price Index, which excludes food and energy, gained 0.2 percent last month, as it did in September and October.

headline.main: Core Inflation Ticks Up, Though Energy Prices Remain Low
headline.print_headline: Energy Prices Remain Low, but Inflation Is Ticking Up
